sen.j: 和田 胤長（わだ たねなが、寿永2年（1183年） - 建暦3年5月9日 (旧暦)（1213年5月30日））は、鎌倉幕府の御家人。
sen.e: Tanenaga WADA (1183-May 30, 1213) was gokenin (an immediate vassal of the shogunate in the Kamakura and Muromachi through Edo periods) of Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).

Tanenaga WADA (1183 - May 30, 1213) was gokenin (an immediate vassal of the shogunate in the Kamakura and Muromachi through Edo periods) of Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
sen.cmt: ハイフンの前後にスペースを1つずつ入れました。
sen.e: Tanenaga WADA (1183 - May 30, 1213) was gokenin (an immediate vassal of the shogunate in the Kamakura and Muromachi through Edo periods) of Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).
He was of a family of Wada clan.
He was a member of the Wada family.
sen.cmt: of a family of→a member of the
sen.e: He was a member of the Wada family.

sen.j: 和田義長の嫡男で、和田義盛の甥。
sen.e: He was a legitimate son of Yoshinaga WADA, and a nephew of Yoshimori WADA.
He was the legitimate son of Yoshinaga WADA, and the nephew of Yoshimori WADA.
sen.cmt: "a"を"the"にそれぞれ変更しました。
sen.e: He was the legitimate son of Yoshinaga WADA, and the nephew of Yoshimori WADA.
His common name was Heita.
He was commonly called Heita.
He was commonly called Heita.
It is said that he was a master of yumi (bow).
It is told that he was a master of yumi (bow).
sen.cmt: 「伝わる」は、"told"の方がより意味が近いと判断し、変更しました。
sen.e: It is told that he was a master of yumi (bow).
Career
Career
Career

sen.j: いとこの和田義直、和田義重（義盛の子）らとともに泉親衡の乱の謀議に加わり、捕縛された。
sen.e: He took a part in the conspiracy of Chikahira IZUMI no ran Rebellion along with his cousins Yoshinao WADA and Yoshishige WADA (Yoshimori's children), etc., and was captured.
He was captured with his cousins, Yoshinao WADA and Yoshishige WADA (Yoshimori's son), by reason that they took part in the conspiracy to commit the revolt of Chikahira IZUMI.
sen.cmt: 英語らしい表現にするため、結論、理由の順序としました。加わる→took part in（took a part inの"a"を削除しました。）下記にて、「義直、義重は赦免されたが」とありますので、謀議に加わったとの理由で捕らえられたのは、胤長一人ではないと判断し、変更しました。
sen.e: He was captured with his cousins, Yoshinao WADA and Yoshishige WADA (Yoshimori's son), by reason that they took part in the conspiracy to commit the revolt of Chikahira IZUMI.

sen.j: このとき義盛の嘆願により義直、義重は赦免されたが、胤長一人だけ赦されず、陸奥国（後の岩代国）岩瀬郡に配流となった。
sen.e: Yoshinao and Yoshishige were pardoned at the entreaty of Yoshimori; only Tanenaga was not pardoned and was exiled to Iwase District, Mutsu Province (later Iwashiro no kuni).
Although Yoshinao and Yoshishige were pardoned thanks to entreaty of Yoshimori, only Tanenaga was not pardoned and was exiled to Iwase District, Mutsu Province (later Iwashiro no kuni).
sen.cmt: （された）が、→Although（althoughで始まる文章に変更しました。）
sen.e: Although Yoshinao and Yoshishige were pardoned thanks to entreaty of Yoshimori, only Tanenaga was not pardoned and was exiled to Iwase District, Mutsu Province (later Iwashiro no kuni).

sen.j: さらに、没収された胤長の屋敷が、慣例に反して義盛には与えられず北条義時が召し上げてしまった。
sen.e: Furthermore, Tanenaga's residence which was confiscated was not given to Yoshimori; although this was uncustomary, the residence was taken away by Yoshitoki HOJO.
Furthermore, Tanenaga's residence which was confiscated was not given to Yoshimori but taken away by Yoshitoki HOJO out of rule.
sen.cmt: セミコロンでつなげたり、また、「慣例に反して」を"although this was uncustomary"と表記されていたため、熟語を使い、簡潔な表現としました。
sen.e: Furthermore, Tanenaga's residence which was confiscated was not given to Yoshimori but taken away by Yoshitoki HOJO out of rule.

sen.j: これがこの後の和田合戦の引き金になったといわれている。
sen.e: This is said to have triggered the Battle of WADA which later took place.
It is said that this incident triggered the subsequent Battle of WADA.
sen.cmt: この後の→subsequent（関係代名詞ではなく、「その後に続いて起こる」の意味の単語を使用し、簡潔な表現としました。）
sen.e: It is said that this incident triggered the subsequent Battle of WADA.

sen.j: 胤長は和田合戦の後、配流地で処刑された。
sen.e: Tanenaga was executed at the place of banishment after the Battle of WADA.
Tanenaga was executed at the place of banishment after the Battle of WADA.
Tanenaga was executed at the place of banishment after the Battle of WADA.
